name: Drop-Off Detective
description: Scenario-based puzzles. Figure out the right disposal plan.

questions.prompt: You finished a can of soda. What should you do?
options: Rinse it and put in recycling
questions.correctAnswer: Rinse it and put in recycling
questions.explanation: Aluminum cans should be rinsed and placed in the recycling bin. They're infinitely recyclable.

questions.prompt: Your phone screen cracked and it won't turn on anymore. What's the best option?
options: Put it in the recycling bin
Take it to a Best Buy for e-waste recycling
questions.correctAnswer: Take it to a Best Buy for e-waste recycling
questions.explanation: Electronics contain valuable metals and toxic materials. Best Buy accepts phones for free recycling.

questions.prompt: You have leftover spaghetti that's gone bad. What do you do?
options: Throw the whole thing in trash
Put pasta in compost, container in recycling
questions.correctAnswer: Put pasta in compost, container in recycling
questions.explanation: Food goes in compost (or trash if no composting). Rinse the container and recycle it separately.

questions.prompt: You're moving and have 10 cardboard boxes. What's the best approach?
options: Put them whole in the recycling bin
questions.correctAnswer: Flatten them and recycle
questions.explanation: Always flatten cardboard boxes before recycling ‚Äî it saves space and helps the recycling process.

questions.prompt: A light bulb burned out. It's a regular incandescent bulb. What do you do?
options: Wrap carefully and put in trash
questions.correctAnswer: Wrap carefully and put in trash
questions.explanation: Incandescent bulbs go in the trash (wrapped for safety). Only CFL bulbs need hazardous waste drop-off.

questions.prompt: You got a package from Amazon. What do you do with the packaging?
options: Recycle the box, trash the bubble wrap and tape
questions.correctAnswer: Recycle the box, trash the bubble wrap and tape
questions.explanation: Flatten the cardboard box and recycle it. Bubble wrap and tape go in trash (or store drop-off for film).

questions.prompt: Your kid's birthday party is over. You have paper plates with cake on them. What do you do?
questions.correctAnswer: Compost them
questions.explanation: Food-soiled paper plates are compostable. If no composting is available, they go in trash (not recycling).

questions.prompt: You spilled paint while doing a home project. There's half a can of latex paint left. What do you do?
options: Let it dry out with kitty litter, then trash
Throw the whole can in the dumpster
questions.correctAnswer: Let it dry out with kitty litter, then trash
questions.explanation: Latex paint can be dried out with kitty litter or sawdust. Once solid, the can goes in trash. Never pour down drains.

questions.prompt: You're cleaning out the garage and find: old paint, dead batteries, and a broken TV. What's your plan?
options: Put everything in one trash bag
Take all three to a hazardous waste facility
Paint to hazardous waste, batteries to hardware store, TV to Best Buy
Throw paint away, recycle batteries, donate TV
questions.correctAnswer: Paint to hazardous waste, batteries to hardware store, TV to Best Buy
questions.explanation: Each item needs a different disposal path. Paint ‚Üí hazardous waste. Batteries ‚Üí hardware store drop-off. TV ‚Üí e-waste recycler like Best Buy.

questions.prompt: You're at a coffee shop and have: a paper cup with plastic lid, a napkin, and a plastic straw. How do you sort?
options: Cup in trash, lid in recycling, napkin in compost, straw in trash
Cup in recycling, rest in trash
questions.correctAnswer: Cup in trash, lid in recycling, napkin in compost, straw in trash
questions.explanation: Lined paper cups ‚Üí trash. Plastic lids ‚Üí often recyclable. Napkins ‚Üí compost. Straws ‚Üí trash (too small for recycling).

questions.prompt: Your medicine cabinet has expired prescriptions. What's the safest disposal?
options: Mix with coffee grounds, seal in a bag, trash
Take to a pharmacy drug take-back program
questions.correctAnswer: Take to a pharmacy drug take-back program
questions.explanation: Pharmacy take-back programs are the safest option. If unavailable, mix with coffee grounds and trash ‚Äî but never flush.

questions.prompt: You have a bag of shredded documents. Where do they go?
options: In a paper bag, then recycling
questions.correctAnswer: In a paper bag, then recycling
questions.explanation: Loose shredded paper falls through recycling screens. Put it in a paper bag first, then recycle the whole thing.

questions.prompt: You're replacing your car battery. What do you do with the old one?
options: Take to AutoZone or similar store
questions.correctAnswer: Take to AutoZone or similar store
questions.explanation: Auto parts stores are required to accept used car batteries for recycling. Lead-acid batteries have a 99% recycling rate.
questions.funFact: Car batteries have the highest recycling rate of any consumer product at 99%.

questions.prompt: You just ate a burrito wrapped in foil. The foil has salsa stains. What do you do?
options: Wipe it off, ball up, and recycle
questions.correctAnswer: Wipe it off, ball up, and recycle
questions.explanation: Aluminum foil with light food residue is recyclable. Give it a quick wipe, ball it up (fist-sized), and recycle.

questions.prompt: Your Keurig coffee pod just brewed. How should you handle it?
options: Peel foil, dump grounds, recycle cup if #5
questions.correctAnswer: Trash the whole pod
questions.explanation: Most K-Cups are mixed materials and go in trash. Some newer pods are #5 recyclable ‚Äî check the label.

questions.prompt: Your smoke detector is beeping (low battery). Time to replace it. What do you do with the old one?
options: Contact your local fire department or hazardous waste
questions.correctAnswer: Contact your local fire department or hazardous waste
questions.explanation: Smoke detectors contain small amounts of radioactive material (Americium-241). Contact your fire department for proper disposal.

questions.prompt: You're hosting Thanksgiving. After dinner you have: turkey bones, aluminum foil trays, a paper tablecloth with food stains, and empty wine bottles. Sort them all.
options: Everything in one big trash bag
Bones ‚Üí compost/trash, foil trays ‚Üí recycle, tablecloth ‚Üí compost, wine bottles ‚Üí recycle
Bones ‚Üí trash, foil ‚Üí trash, tablecloth ‚Üí recycle, bottles ‚Üí trash
questions.correctAnswer: Bones ‚Üí compost/trash, foil trays ‚Üí recycle, tablecloth ‚Üí compost, wine bottles ‚Üí recycle
questions.explanation: Turkey bones ‚Üí compost if available (industrial), otherwise trash. Rinse foil trays ‚Üí recycle. Food-soiled paper ‚Üí compost. Glass bottles ‚Üí recycle.

questions.prompt: You find a box of old VHS tapes in the attic. What do you do?
questions.correctAnswer: Trash them
questions.explanation: VHS tapes are mixed materials (plastic case + magnetic tape). The tape tangles in recycling machinery. Unfortunately, most go in trash.

questions.prompt: Your kitchen sponge is worn out and smelly. What do you do?
questions.correctAnswer: Trash it
questions.explanation: Synthetic sponges are made of mixed plastics and are not recyclable or compostable. Trash them.

questions.prompt: You're doing spring cleaning and have: a broken umbrella, a worn yoga mat, 3 tangled extension cords, and old sunglasses. What's the plan?
options: Umbrella ‚Üí trash, yoga mat ‚Üí trash, cords ‚Üí e-waste drop-off, sunglasses ‚Üí donate
Umbrella ‚Üí metal recycling, rest in trash
questions.correctAnswer: Umbrella ‚Üí trash, yoga mat ‚Üí trash, cords ‚Üí e-waste drop-off, sunglasses ‚Üí donate
questions.explanation: Umbrellas (mixed materials) ‚Üí trash. Yoga mats ‚Üí trash. Extension cords ‚Üí e-waste (copper is valuable, tangles in machinery). Sunglasses ‚Üí donate if wearable.

questions.prompt: You microwaved something in a paper bowl and it now has a burn mark. Is it still compostable?
options: No, the burn makes it toxic ‚Äî trash
Yes, but only if you cut out the burned part
questions.correctAnswer: Yes, compost it
questions.explanation: A minor burn mark on paper doesn't make it toxic. It's still compostable. Only plastic-coated paper bowls are non-compostable.

questions.prompt: Your kid brought home a glitter-covered art project from school. It's falling apart. What do you do?
questions.correctAnswer: Trash it
questions.explanation: Glitter is microplastic. Paper with glitter contamaminates the recycling stream and cannot be composted safely.
questions.funFact: Most glitter is made from PET plastic bonded to aluminum ‚Äî it's technically a microplastic.

questions.prompt: You accidentally broke a CFL (curly) light bulb. What should you do?
options: Open windows, leave room for 15 minutes, clean up with damp paper towels
Sweep it up and put in recycling
It's fine, just throw the pieces away
questions.correctAnswer: Open windows, leave room for 15 minutes, clean up with damp paper towels
questions.explanation: CFL bulbs contain mercury vapor. Ventilate the room, wait 15 min, then carefully clean with damp paper towels (not vacuum ‚Äî it spreads mercury). Seal in a bag and take to hazardous waste.

questions.prompt: You're moving to a new apartment and your mattress is stained and old. Options?
options: Schedule a bulk pickup with the city
Take it to any recycling center
questions.correctAnswer: Schedule a bulk pickup with the city
questions.explanation: Most cities require you to schedule mattress pickup. Never leave large items on the curb without an appointment ‚Äî you may be fined.

questions.prompt: A lithium battery in an old laptop is swelling (puffy/bloated). This is potentially dangerous. What do you do?
options: Put in the trash in a fireproof bag
Take to a battery recycling drop-off immediately, handle carefully
Pop it with a pin to release pressure
Put in the freezer to stop swelling
questions.correctAnswer: Take to a battery recycling drop-off immediately, handle carefully
questions.explanation: Swollen lithium batteries are a fire risk. Do NOT puncture, crush, or put in trash. Place on a non-flammable surface and take to a battery recycling facility ASAP.
questions.funFact: Lithium battery fires burn at 1,100¬∞F and cannot be extinguished with water.

questions.prompt: You're renovating and removed old lead paint from the walls. How do you dispose of the paint chips and dust?
questions.correctAnswer: Hazardous waste facility, properly sealed
questions.explanation: Lead paint is toxic waste. Seal chips and dust in heavy plastic bags and take to a hazardous waste facility. Lead exposure causes serious health issues.

questions.prompt: You work in an office and someone put a toner cartridge in the regular trash. What should happen?
options: Fish it out ‚Äî return to Staples/Office Depot for recycling
Put it in the recycling bin instead
questions.correctAnswer: Fish it out ‚Äî return to Staples/Office Depot for recycling
questions.explanation: Toner cartridges contain plastic and residual toner (fine carbon powder). Office supply stores accept them for free recycling.

questions.prompt: Your neighbor asks you to help dispose of a mercury thermometer. What's the correct approach?
options: Wrap carefully and put in regular trash
Take to a pharmacy or hazardous waste facility
Break it and clean up the mercury with a vacuum
Put in the recycling ‚Äî it's glass and metal
questions.correctAnswer: Take to a pharmacy or hazardous waste facility
questions.explanation: Mercury is extremely toxic. Never vacuum mercury ‚Äî it spreads vapors. Take intact thermometers to hazardous waste. If broken, call your local poison control for cleanup instructions.

questions.prompt: A local business offers free 'recycled' products but uses misleading green labels. What is this practice called?
questions.correctAnswer: Greenwashing
questions.explanation: Greenwashing is when companies mislead consumers about the environmental benefits of their products or practices.

questions.prompt: You have a fire extinguisher that's expired. What do you do?
options: Discharge fully, then recycle as metal
Take to a fire department or hazardous waste
questions.correctAnswer: Take to a fire department or hazardous waste
questions.explanation: Fire extinguishers are pressurized containers with chemical agents. Many fire departments accept them, or take to hazardous waste.

questions.prompt: Your local recycling plant is a 'single-stream' facility. What does that mean for you?
options: You can only recycle one type of material
All recyclables go in one bin ‚Äî no sorting needed
You need to wash everything first
Recycling happens one item at a time
questions.correctAnswer: All recyclables go in one bin ‚Äî no sorting needed
questions.explanation: Single-stream recycling means all recyclables (paper, plastic, glass, metal) go into one bin. The facility sorts them using technology.

questions.prompt: You discover that your 'compostable' coffee cup has a PLA (plant-based plastic) lining. Your home compost can't handle it. What do you do?
options: Take to an industrial composting facility
It will compost in your home bin eventually
questions.correctAnswer: Trash it
questions.explanation: PLA needs industrial composting (130-170¬∞F) to break down. Most cities don't accept PLA in curbside composting. If there's no industrial composting nearby, it unfortunately goes in trash.
